page.title: 14 PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: {Ladybank}has{11 artesian wells}giving a{constant}supply of{mineral water. {Most}of these{wells are on private {property}but one is{open ground}for {access}by the{public. The Water Tower was{built}in{1908. Windmills pumped {water from a depth of 374 feet into the{holding tanks}then{piped}to the {houses.}It is now{only used}in {droughts e.g. summer 1984.}In Spring the fields of Kingskettle are covered in polythene to encourage the green vegetables to grow quickly.{Ladybank is fortunate in having a{British Open {Qualifying Golf Course built in 1879 {as a six hole course. Over the years {this has been extended to 18 holes {with a new clubhouse built in 1971. {The course was purchased in 1950 for {Â£850.}There is War Memorial with an attractive garden behind it. At one time this garden was a putting green.
